concept.title: YUV Pixel Formats
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides detailed information about the supported YUV pixel formats.

conbody.p: For an introduction to YUV, see YUV Pixel Formats Overview

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_444Interleaved
section.p: This is a YUV 4:4:4 image format. It is an interleaved format. There are 16 effective bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The pixel order is Y00U00V00 Y01U01V01....

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_444Planar
section.p: This is a YUV 4:4:4 image format. It is a planar format. There are 24 effective bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The pixel order is Y00Y01Y02Y03…U00U01U02U03…V00V01V02V03...

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_422Interleaved
section.p: This is one of the most popular of the YUV 4:2:2 image formats. It is an interleaved format. There are 16 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample.

fig.title: Byte order for the EUidPixelFormatYUV_422Interleaved format

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_422Reversed
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:2 image format. It is a reversed format. There are 16 bits per pixel. The FOURCC ID of this format is 0x32595559.

fig.title: Byte order for the EUidPixelFormatYUV_422Reversed format

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_422Planar
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:2 image format. It is a planar format and is a popular choice for software MPEG codecs. There are 16 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. Each component is stored as a separate array and the final image is a fusion of the three separate planes. The pixel order is Y00Y01Y02Y03...U00U02...V00V02...

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_422SemiPlanar
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:2 image format. It is a semiplanar format. There are 16 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The Y plane is followed by an interleaved U/V plane with 2x2 subsampling. The pixel order is Y00Y01Y02Y03...U00V00...

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_422InterleavedReversed
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:2 image format. It is an interleaved format. There are 16 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The pixel order is Y1VY0U.

fig.title: Byte order for the EUidPixelFormatYUV_422InterleavedReversed format

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYYUV_422Interleaved
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:2 image format. It is an interleaved format. There are 16 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The pixel order is Y0Y1UV.

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_420Interleaved
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:0 image format. It is an interleaved format. There are 12 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. 4 Y plane samples are followed by 2 8-bit U and V samples. The Pixel order is Y00Y01Y10Y11UV.

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_420Planar
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:0 image format. It is a planar format. There are 12 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The Y plane samples are followed by 2x2 subsampled U and V planes. The pixel order is Y00Y01Y02Y03...U0...V0...

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_420PlanarReversed
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:0 image format. It is a planar reversed format. There are 12 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The Y plane samples are followed by 8 bits 2x2 subsampled V and U planes. The pixel order is Y00Y01Y02Y03...V0...U0...

section.title: EUidPixelFormatYUV_420SemiPlanar
section.p: This is a YUV 4:2:0 image format. It is a semiplanar format. There are 12 bits per pixel and 8 bits per sample. The Y plane samples are followed by an interleaved U/V plane with 2x2 subsampling. The pixel order is Y00Y01Y02Y03...U0V0...
